meanings.definition: Torchwoods: a genus of evergreen trees or shrubs native to the Americas.
meanings.sent1: The torchwoods in the forest provide shade and shelter for many animals.
meanings.sent2: I learned about torchwoods in my science class last week.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the torchwoods were the perfect spot to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The torchwoods stood tall like guardians of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The torchwoods swayed gently in the breeze, their leaves shimmering in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Torchwoods: a fictional organization in the television series Doctor Who.
meanings.sent1: The Torchwoods in the show are always dealing with mysterious alien threats.
meanings.sent2: Fans of Doctor Who love discussing the latest Torchwoods episodes.
meanings.sent3: In the Doctor Who universe, the Torchwoods have the coolest gadgets.
meanings.sent4: The Torchwoods operate in secrecy, hidden from the public eye.
meanings.sent5: Joining the Torchwoods would be an adventure of a lifetime for any sci-fi fan.

meanings.definition: Torchwoods: the plural form of torchwood, referring to the wood of a torch.
meanings.sent1: The torchwoods burned brightly, illuminating the dark cave.
meanings.sent2: The torchwoods were essential for lighting up the path during the night.
meanings.sent3: The campers gathered around the torchwoods, telling stories under their warm glow.
meanings.sent4: She carved intricate designs into the torchwoods to create beautiful patterns.
meanings.sent5: The torchwoods crackled and popped as they consumed the last bits of fuel.
